import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(
        _ title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }
    }
}

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

**Implementation:**
```swift
import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {
    let value: String
    let label: String
    let icon: String?
}

struct StatsBar: View {
    let stats: [StatItem]
    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

    enum StatsStyle {
        case horizontal
        case vertical
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            switch style {
            case .horizontal:
                horizontalLayout
            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout
            }
        }
    }

    private var horizontalLayout: some View {
        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat)
                    .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

    private var verticalLayout: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
}

struct StatItemView: View {
    let stat: StatItem
    var isVertical: Bool = false

    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
            if let icon = stat.icon {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.brandPrimary)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)
            }

            Text(stat.value)
                .font(.title3)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Text(stat.label)
                .font(.caption)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
        }
        .padding(.spacing3)
        .frame(maxWidth: isVertical ? .infinity : nil, alignment: isVertical ? .leading : .center)
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel("\(stat.value) \(stat.label)")
    }
}
```

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}

## Risk Management

### Identified Risks

1. **Scope Creep**
   - *Risk:* Adding features instead of focusing on design system
   - *Mitigation:* Strict adherence to plan, no new features
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

4. **Accessibility Complexity**
   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected
   - *Mitigation:* Start early, dedicate full week
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

5. **Device Coverage**
   - *Risk:* Not enough devices for thorough testing
   - *Mitigation:* Use simulator + TestFlight beta
   - *Impact:* Low
   - *Likelihood:* Low

### Contingency Plans

**If behind schedule after Week 2:**
- Focus on critical components only (GlassCard, BrandButton, FeedPost)
- Defer nice-to-have components to Phase 6
- Maintain accessibility as non-negotiable

**If breaking changes occur:**
- Revert to last working state
- Implement changes in smaller increments
- Add unit tests before proceeding

**If accessibility goals unreachable:**
- Focus on VoiceOver and Dynamic Type (highest impact)
- Defer color contrast to minor iteration
- Maintain 90% coverage minimum

**Current Grade:** C+ (68/100)
**Target Grade:** A+ (95+/100)
**Timeline:** 4-6 weeks

9. [Progress Tracking](#progress-tracking)
10. [Success Metrics](#success-metrics)

---

## Executive Summary

### Current Issues
- **No design system** - Colors, spacing, typography hardcoded everywhere
- **Massive code duplication** - 2,000+ lines of duplicated components
- **Accessibility gaps** - Missing VoiceOver, Dynamic Type, contrast compliance
- **Inconsistent UX** - Different patterns across user types

### Goals
- âœ… Reduce codebase by 33% (~5,000 lines)
- âœ… Achieve WCAG AA accessibility compliance
- âœ… Implement centralized design system
- âœ… Create reusable component library
- âœ… Achieve A+ grade (95+/100)

### Impact
- **Development velocity:** 3x faster feature development
- **Maintenance:** 5x easier to update designs
- **User experience:** Consistent, professional, accessible
- **Code quality:** DRY principles, SwiftUI best practices

---

## Current State Analysis

### Category Breakdown

| Category | Current Score | Target Score | Gap |
|----------|---------------|--------------|-----|
| Design Consistency | D+ (45/100) | A+ (95/100) | 50 pts |
| iOS Guidelines | B- (72/100) | A+ (95/100) | 23 pts |
| User Experience | C+ (68/100) | A+ (95/100) | 27 pts |
| Component Reusability | D (50/100) | A+ (95/100) | 45 pts |

- **Messages/Search:** `Color(red: 0.1, green: 0.1, blue: 0.2)`
- **No centralized palette**

**Files affected:** 15+ view files

- `FeedPost` - 414 lines duplicated
- `GlassCard background` - 50+ instances
- `Form fields` - 15+ variations
- `Circle filters` - 2 different implementations
- `Empty states` - 4 different implementations

#### 3. Typography Chaos (30+ variations)
- `.system(size: 44)` vs `.largeTitle`
- `.title2.fontWeight(.bold)` vs `.system(size: 32, weight: .bold)`
- Brand name: "AthleadAI" vs "ATHLEAD" vs different sizes

#### 4. Accessibility Failures
- âŒ No `.accessibilityLabel()` on icon-only buttons (20+ instances)
- âŒ No Dynamic Type support
- âŒ No contrast verification
- âŒ No Reduce Motion support
- âŒ Images lack descriptions

#### 5. Corner Radius Inconsistency
- Buttons: 8, 14, 20, 22 pt
- Cards: 8, 12, 16, 18 pt
- Inputs: 8, 12, 20 pt

---

import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(
        _ title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void

        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct BrandTextField: View {
    let label: String
    let icon: String
    let placeholder: String
    @Binding var text: String

    var keyboardType: UIKeyboardType = .default
    var autocapitalization: TextInputAutocapitalization = .words
    var errorMessage: String? = nil
    var successMessage: String? = nil

    @FocusState private var isFocused: Bool

    var body: some View {
        VStack(alignment: .leading, spacing: .spacing2) {
            // Label
            Text(label)
                .font(.subheadline)
                .fontWeight(.medium)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            // Input field
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                    .frame(width: 20)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)

                TextField(placeholder, text: $text)
                    .keyboardType(keyboardType)
                    .textInputAutocapitalization(autocapitalization)
                    .focused($isFocused)
                    .accessibilityLabel("\(label) field")

                // Clear button
                if !text.isEmpty {
                    Button {
                        text = ""
                    } label: {
                        Image(systemName: "xmark.circle.fill")
                            .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                    }
                    .accessibilityLabel("Clear \(label)")
                }

                // Status icon
                if let _ = errorMessage {
                    Image(systemName: "exclamationmark.circle.fill")
                        .foregroundColor(.error)
                        .accessibilityHidden(true)
                } else if let _ = successMessage {
                    Image(systemName: "checkmark.circle.fill")
                        .foregroundColor(.success)
                        .accessibilityHidden(true)
                }
            }
            .padding()
            .background(Color(.systemGray6))
            .cornerRadius(.radiusMedium)
            .overlay(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusMedium)
                    .stroke(borderColor, lineWidth: isFocused ? 2 : 0)
            )

            // Error/Success message
            if let errorMessage = errorMessage {
                Label(errorMessage, systemImage: "exclamationmark.circle")
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.error)
                    .accessibilityLabel("Error: \(errorMessage)")
            } else if let successMessage = successMessage {
                Label(successMessage, systemImage: "checkmark.circle")
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.success)
                    .accessibilityLabel(successMessage)
            }
        }
    }

    private var borderColor: Color {
        if errorMessage != nil {
            return .error
        } else if successMessage != nil {
            return .success
        } else {
            return .brandPrimary
        }
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

struct CircleFilter: View {
    let name: String
    let icon: String?
    let imageName: String?
    let iconColor: Color
    let isSelected: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    init(
        name: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        imageName: String? = nil,
        iconColor: Color = .blue,
        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.name = name
        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Button(action: action) {
            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.2), Color.white.opacity(0.1)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            )
                        )
                        .frame(width: 64, height: 64)

                    // Content (image or icon)
                    if let imageName = imageName {
                        Image(imageName)
                            .resizable()
                            .scaledToFill()
                            .frame(width: 64, height: 64)
                            .clipShape(Circle())
                    } else if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                            .font(.system(size: 28))
                            .foregroundColor(isSelected ? iconColor : .gray)
                    }
                }

                // Name label
                Text(name)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .fontWeight(isSelected ? .semibold : .regular)
                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
                    .lineLimit(1)
            }
            .frame(width: 80)
        }
        .accessibilityLabel("\(name) filter")
        .accessibilityAddTraits(isSelected ? .isSelected : [])
        .accessibilityHint(isSelected ? "Currently selected" : "Double tap to select")
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}

## Risk Management

### Identified Risks

1. **Scope Creep**
   - *Risk:* Adding features instead of focusing on design system
   - *Mitigation:* Strict adherence to plan, no new features
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

4. **Accessibility Complexity**
   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected
   - *Mitigation:* Start early, dedicate full week
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

5. **Device Coverage**
   - *Risk:* Not enough devices for thorough testing
   - *Mitigation:* Use simulator + TestFlight beta
   - *Impact:* Low
   - *Likelihood:* Low

### Contingency Plans

**If behind schedule after Week 2:**
- Focus on critical components only (GlassCard, BrandButton, FeedPost)
- Defer nice-to-have components to Phase 6
- Maintain accessibility as non-negotiable

**If breaking changes occur:**
- Revert to last working state
- Implement changes in smaller increments
- Add unit tests before proceeding

**If accessibility goals unreachable:**
- Focus on VoiceOver and Dynamic Type (highest impact)
- Defer color contrast to minor iteration
- Maintain 90% coverage minimum

import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

            .font(theme.font(.body))
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.cardforeground))
    }
}

// Modifier version

    Text("Hello")
}
.glassCard()
```

import SwiftUI

// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(
        _ title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }
    }
}

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

struct BrandTextField: View {
    let label: String
    let icon: String
    let placeholder: String
    @Binding var text: String

    var keyboardType: UIKeyboardType = .default
    var autocapitalization: TextInputAutocapitalization = .words
    var errorMessage: String? = nil
    var successMessage: String? = nil

    @FocusState private var isFocused: Bool

    var body: some View {
        VStack(alignment: .leading, spacing: .spacing2) {
            // Label
            Text(label)
                .font(.subheadline)
                .fontWeight(.medium)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            // Input field
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                    .frame(width: 20)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)

                TextField(placeholder, text: $text)
                    .keyboardType(keyboardType)
                    .textInputAutocapitalization(autocapitalization)
                    .focused($isFocused)
                    .accessibilityLabel("\(label) field")

                // Clear button
                if !text.isEmpty {
                    Button {
                        text = ""
                    } label: {
                        Image(systemName: "xmark.circle.fill")
                            .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                    }
                    .accessibilityLabel("Clear \(label)")
                }

                // Status icon
                if let _ = errorMessage {
                    Image(systemName: "exclamationmark.circle.fill")
                        .foregroundColor(.error)
                        .accessibilityHidden(true)
                } else if let _ = successMessage {
                    Image(systemName: "checkmark.circle.fill")
                        .foregroundColor(.success)
                        .accessibilityHidden(true)
                }
            }
            .padding()
            .background(Color(.systemGray6))
            .cornerRadius(.radiusMedium)
            .overlay(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusMedium)
                    .stroke(borderColor, lineWidth: isFocused ? 2 : 0)
            )

            // Error/Success message
            if let errorMessage = errorMessage {
                Label(errorMessage, systemImage: "exclamationmark.circle")
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.error)
                    .accessibilityLabel("Error: \(errorMessage)")
            } else if let successMessage = successMessage {
                Label(successMessage, systemImage: "checkmark.circle")
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.success)
                    .accessibilityLabel(successMessage)
            }
        }
    }

    private var borderColor: Color {
        if errorMessage != nil {
            return .error
        } else if successMessage != nil {
            return .success
        } else {
            return .brandPrimary
        }
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

struct CircleFilter: View {
    let name: String
    let icon: String?
    let imageName: String?
    let iconColor: Color
    let isSelected: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    init(
        name: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        imageName: String? = nil,
        iconColor: Color = .blue,
        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.name = name
        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Button(action: action) {
            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.2), Color.white.opacity(0.1)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            )
                        )
                        .frame(width: 64, height: 64)

                    // Content (image or icon)
                    if let imageName = imageName {
                        Image(imageName)
                            .resizable()
                            .scaledToFill()
                            .frame(width: 64, height: 64)
                            .clipShape(Circle())
                    } else if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                            .font(.system(size: 28))
                            .foregroundColor(isSelected ? iconColor : .gray)
                    }
                }

                // Name label
                Text(name)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .fontWeight(isSelected ? .semibold : .regular)
                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
                    .lineLimit(1)
            }
            .frame(width: 80)
        }
        .accessibilityLabel("\(name) filter")
        .accessibilityAddTraits(isSelected ? .isSelected : [])
        .accessibilityHint(isSelected ? "Currently selected" : "Double tap to select")
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor

        self.action = nil

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

import SwiftUI

    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

            switch style {
            case .horizontal:

            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout

        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in

        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()

            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct BrandTextField: View {
    let label: String
    let icon: String
    let placeholder: String
    @Binding var text: String

    var keyboardType: UIKeyboardType = .default
    var autocapitalization: TextInputAutocapitalization = .words
    var errorMessage: String? = nil
    var successMessage: String? = nil

    @FocusState private var isFocused: Bool

    var body: some View {
        VStack(alignment: .leading, spacing: .spacing2) {
            // Label
            Text(label)
                .font(.subheadline)
                .fontWeight(.medium)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            // Input field
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                    .frame(width: 20)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)

                TextField(placeholder, text: $text)
                    .keyboardType(keyboardType)
                    .textInputAutocapitalization(autocapitalization)
                    .focused($isFocused)
                    .accessibilityLabel("\(label) field")

                // Clear button
                if !text.isEmpty {
                    Button {
                        text = ""
                    } label: {
                        Image(systemName: "xmark.circle.fill")
                            .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                    }
                    .accessibilityLabel("Clear \(label)")
                }

                // Status icon
                if let _ = errorMessage {
                    Image(systemName: "exclamationmark.circle.fill")
                        .foregroundColor(.error)
                        .accessibilityHidden(true)
                } else if let _ = successMessage {
                    Image(systemName: "checkmark.circle.fill")
                        .foregroundColor(.success)
                        .accessibilityHidden(true)
                }
            }
            .padding()
            .background(Color(.systemGray6))
            .cornerRadius(.radiusMedium)
            .overlay(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusMedium)
                    .stroke(borderColor, lineWidth: isFocused ? 2 : 0)
            )

            // Error/Success message
            if let errorMessage = errorMessage {
                Label(errorMessage, systemImage: "exclamationmark.circle")
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.error)
                    .accessibilityLabel("Error: \(errorMessage)")
            } else if let successMessage = successMessage {
                Label(successMessage, systemImage: "checkmark.circle")
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.success)
                    .accessibilityLabel(successMessage)
            }
        }
    }

    private var borderColor: Color {
        if errorMessage != nil {
            return .error
        } else if successMessage != nil {
            return .success
        } else {
            return .brandPrimary
        }
    }
}

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {
    let value: String
    let label: String
    let icon: String?
}

struct StatsBar: View {
    let stats: [StatItem]
    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

    enum StatsStyle {
        case horizontal
        case vertical
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            switch style {
            case .horizontal:
                horizontalLayout
            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout
            }
        }
    }

    private var horizontalLayout: some View {
        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat)
                    .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

    private var verticalLayout: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
}

struct StatItemView: View {
    let stat: StatItem
    var isVertical: Bool = false

    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
            if let icon = stat.icon {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.brandPrimary)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)
            }

            Text(stat.value)
                .font(.title3)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Text(stat.label)
                .font(.caption)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
        }
        .padding(.spacing3)
        .frame(maxWidth: isVertical ? .infinity : nil, alignment: isVertical ? .leading : .center)
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel("\(stat.value) \(stat.label)")
    }
}

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}

import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}

// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading

        self.isLoading = isLoading

            action()

struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle

    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(

        icon: String? = nil,

        isLoading: Bool = false,

import SwiftUI

struct BrandTextField: View {
    let label: String
    let icon: String
    let placeholder: String
    @Binding var text: String

    var keyboardType: UIKeyboardType = .default
    var autocapitalization: TextInputAutocapitalization = .words
    var errorMessage: String? = nil
    var successMessage: String? = nil

    @FocusState private var isFocused: Bool

    var body: some View {
        VStack(alignment: .leading, spacing: .spacing2) {
            // Label
            Text(label)
                .font(.subheadline)
                .fontWeight(.medium)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            // Input field
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                    .frame(width: 20)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)

                TextField(placeholder, text: $text)
                    .keyboardType(keyboardType)
                    .textInputAutocapitalization(autocapitalization)
                    .focused($isFocused)
                    .accessibilityLabel("\(label) field")

                // Clear button
                if !text.isEmpty {
                    Button {
                        text = ""
                    } label: {
                        Image(systemName: "xmark.circle.fill")
                            .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                    }
                    .accessibilityLabel("Clear \(label)")
                }

                // Status icon
                if let _ = errorMessage {
                    Image(systemName: "exclamationmark.circle.fill")
                        .foregroundColor(.error)
                        .accessibilityHidden(true)
                } else if let _ = successMessage {
                    Image(systemName: "checkmark.circle.fill")
                        .foregroundColor(.success)
                        .accessibilityHidden(true)
                }
            }
            .padding()
            .background(Color(.systemGray6))
            .cornerRadius(.radiusMedium)
            .overlay(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusMedium)
                    .stroke(borderColor, lineWidth: isFocused ? 2 : 0)
            )

            // Error/Success message
            if let errorMessage = errorMessage {
                Label(errorMessage, systemImage: "exclamationmark.circle")
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.error)
                    .accessibilityLabel("Error: \(errorMessage)")
            } else if let successMessage = successMessage {
                Label(successMessage, systemImage: "checkmark.circle")
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.success)
                    .accessibilityLabel(successMessage)
            }
        }
    }

    private var borderColor: Color {
        if errorMessage != nil {
            return .error
        } else if successMessage != nil {
            return .success
        } else {
            return .brandPrimary
        }
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct CircleFilter: View {
    let name: String
    let icon: String?
    let imageName: String?
    let iconColor: Color
    let isSelected: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    init(
        name: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        imageName: String? = nil,
        iconColor: Color = .blue,
        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.name = name
        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Button(action: action) {
            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.2), Color.white.opacity(0.1)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            )
                        )
                        .frame(width: 64, height: 64)

                    // Content (image or icon)
                    if let imageName = imageName {
                        Image(imageName)
                            .resizable()
                            .scaledToFill()
                            .frame(width: 64, height: 64)
                            .clipShape(Circle())
                    } else if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                            .font(.system(size: 28))
                            .foregroundColor(isSelected ? iconColor : .gray)
                    }
                }

                // Name label
                Text(name)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .fontWeight(isSelected ? .semibold : .regular)
                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
                    .lineLimit(1)
            }
            .frame(width: 80)
        }
        .accessibilityLabel("\(name) filter")
        .accessibilityAddTraits(isSelected ? .isSelected : [])
        .accessibilityHint(isSelected ? "Currently selected" : "Double tap to select")
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {
    let value: String
    let label: String
    let icon: String?
}

struct StatsBar: View {
    let stats: [StatItem]
    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

    enum StatsStyle {
        case horizontal
        case vertical
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            switch style {
            case .horizontal:
                horizontalLayout
            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout
            }
        }
    }

    private var horizontalLayout: some View {
        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat)
                    .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

    private var verticalLayout: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
}

struct StatItemView: View {
    let stat: StatItem
    var isVertical: Bool = false

    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
            if let icon = stat.icon {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.brandPrimary)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)
            }

            Text(stat.value)
                .font(.title3)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Text(stat.label)
                .font(.caption)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
        }
        .padding(.spacing3)
        .frame(maxWidth: isVertical ? .infinity : nil, alignment: isVertical ? .leading : .center)
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel("\(stat.value) \(stat.label)")
    }
}
```

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}

## Risk Management

### Identified Risks

1. **Scope Creep**
   - *Risk:* Adding features instead of focusing on design system
   - *Mitigation:* Strict adherence to plan, no new features
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

4. **Accessibility Complexity**
   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected
   - *Mitigation:* Start early, dedicate full week
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

5. **Device Coverage**
   - *Risk:* Not enough devices for thorough testing
   - *Mitigation:* Use simulator + TestFlight beta
   - *Impact:* Low
   - *Likelihood:* Low

### Contingency Plans

**If behind schedule after Week 2:**
- Focus on critical components only (GlassCard, BrandButton, FeedPost)
- Defer nice-to-have components to Phase 6
- Maintain accessibility as non-negotiable

**If breaking changes occur:**
- Revert to last working state
- Implement changes in smaller increments

# iOS UI/UX Design Improvement Plan
## AthleadAI - From C+ to A+ Grade

**Current Grade:** C+ (68/100)
**Target Grade:** A+ (95+/100)
**Timeline:** 4-6 weeks
**Last Updated:** 2025-10-05

---

## Table of Contents
1. [Executive Summary](#executive-summary)
2. [Current State Analysis](#current-state-analysis)
3. [Implementation Roadmap](#implementation-roadmap)
4. [Phase 1: Foundation](#phase-1-foundation-week-1)

8. [Phase 5: Quality Assurance](#phase-5-quality-assurance-week-5)

---

## Executive Summary

### Current Issues
- **No design system** - Colors, spacing, typography hardcoded everywhere
- **Massive code duplication** - 2,000+ lines of duplicated components
- **Accessibility gaps** - Missing VoiceOver, Dynamic Type, contrast compliance
- **Inconsistent UX** - Different patterns across user types

### Goals
- âœ… Reduce codebase by 33% (~5,000 lines)
- âœ… Achieve WCAG AA accessibility compliance
- âœ… Implement centralized design system
- âœ… Create reusable component library
- âœ… Achieve A+ grade (95+/100)

### Impact
- **Development velocity:** 3x faster feature development
- **Maintenance:** 5x easier to update designs
- **User experience:** Consistent, professional, accessible
- **Code quality:** DRY principles, SwiftUI best practices

---

## Current State Analysis

### Category Breakdown

| Category | Current Score | Target Score | Gap |
|----------|---------------|--------------|-----|
| Design Consistency | D+ (45/100) | A+ (95/100) | 50 pts |
| iOS Guidelines | B- (72/100) | A+ (95/100) | 23 pts |
| User Experience | C+ (68/100) | A+ (95/100) | 27 pts |
| Component Reusability | D (50/100) | A+ (95/100) | 45 pts |
| Accessibility | D- (48/100) | A+ (95/100) | 47 pts |
| **Overall** | **C+ (68/100)** | **A+ (95/100)** | **27 pts** |

### Critical Issues Found

#### 1. Color Inconsistency (45 instances)
- **Auth flows:** `[.blue, .purple]`
- **Feed views:** `Color(red: 0.25, green: 0.35, blue: 0.55)`
- **Messages/Search:** `Color(red: 0.1, green: 0.1, blue: 0.2)`

- `GlassCard background` - 50+ instances
- `Form fields` - 15+ variations
- `Circle filters` - 2 different implementations
- `Empty states` - 4 different implementations

#### 3. Typography Chaos (30+ variations)
- `.system(size: 44)` vs `.largeTitle`
- `.title2.fontWeight(.bold)` vs `.system(size: 32, weight: .bold)`
- Brand name: "AthleadAI" vs "ATHLEAD" vs different sizes

#### 4. Accessibility Failures
- âŒ No `.accessibilityLabel()` on icon-only buttons (20+ instances)
- âŒ No Dynamic Type support
- âŒ No contrast verification
- âŒ No Reduce Motion support
- âŒ Images lack descriptions

#### 5. Corner Radius Inconsistency
- Buttons: 8, 14, 20, 22 pt
- Cards: 8, 12, 16, 18 pt
- Inputs: 8, 12, 20 pt

## Implementation Roadmap

### Overview

```
Week 1: Foundation          â†’ Design System Core

---

## Phase 1: Foundation (Week 1)

**Goal:** Extend existing design system and replace 50% of hardcoded values

### ğŸ‰ GREAT NEWS: Design System Foundation Already Exists!

**File:** `apps/ios/athleadai/Views/Shared/DesignSystem/DesignSystem.swift`

The hardest part is already done! We have a professional-grade design system with:

#### âœ… What We Already Have:
1. **Complete Color System**
   - 45+ semantic color tokens (DSColorToken)
   - Full light/dark mode support
   - Automatic theme switching
   - Professional color palette (indigo primary, clean grays)

2. **Typography System**
   - All text styles defined (largeTitle â†’ caption2)
   - Dynamic Type support built-in âœ…
   - SF System fonts (native iOS)

3. **Theme Architecture**
   - `DesignTheme.defaultLight` and `DesignTheme.defaultDark`
   - Easy color access: `theme.color(.primary)`
   - Easy font access: `theme.font(.body)`

4. **Example Components**
   - DSButton with 3 variants already implemented
   - Size system (small, medium, large)
   - Accessibility built-in

#### ğŸ“ What We Need to Add:

**Time Saved:** ~8 hours! The design system foundation would have taken 2 days to build from scratch. We can now focus on components and migration.

---

### 1.1 Extend & Enhance Existing Design System â±ï¸ 3 hours

**File:** `apps/ios/athleadai/Views/Shared/DesignSystem/DesignSystem.swift` âœ… ALREADY EXISTS

**Current State:**
- âœ… Color tokens defined (DSColorToken enum with 45+ tokens)
- âœ… Typography system (DSTextStyle with Dynamic Type support)
- âœ… Theme system (DesignTheme with light/dark modes)
- âœ… Button component (DSButton with primary/secondary/destructive)
- âœ… Automatic light/dark mode support

**Tasks:**
- [x] ~~Create color palette~~ âœ… Already done
- [x] ~~Define typography scale~~ âœ… Already done with Dynamic Type
- [x] Add spacing scale (4pt grid system) âœ… COMPLETED 2025-10-05
- [x] Add corner radius scale âœ… COMPLETED 2025-10-05
- [ ] Add shadow/elevation tokens
- [x] Add gradient definitions for app-specific use âœ… COMPLETED 2025-10-05
- [x] Create theme environment key for app-wide access âœ… COMPLETED 2025-10-05

**Additions Needed:**

**File:** `apps/ios/athleadai/Views/Shared/DesignSystem/DesignTokens+Extensions.swift` (NEW)

```swift
import SwiftUI

// MARK: - Spacing Extensions (4pt grid)
extension CGFloat {
    static let spacing1: CGFloat = 4   // XS
    static let spacing2: CGFloat = 8   // S
    static let spacing3: CGFloat = 12  // M
    static let spacing4: CGFloat = 16  // L (default)
    static let spacing5: CGFloat = 20  // XL
    static let spacing6: CGFloat = 24  // XXL
    static let spacing8: CGFloat = 32  // 3XL
    static let spacing10: CGFloat = 40 // 4XL
}

// MARK: - Corner Radius
extension CGFloat {
    static let radiusSmall: CGFloat = 8
    static let radiusMedium: CGFloat = 12
    static let radiusLarge: CGFloat = 16
    static let radiusXLarge: CGFloat = 20
}

// MARK: - Gradients for Sports App
extension LinearGradient {
    static let athleteGradient = LinearGradient(
        colors: [Color(hex: "#6366F1"), Color(hex: "#818CF8")],
        startPoint: .topLeading,
        endPoint: .bottomTrailing
    )

    static let coachGradient = LinearGradient(
        colors: [Color(hex: "#EF4444"), Color(hex: "#F87171")],
        startPoint: .topLeading,
        endPoint: .bottomTrailing
    )
}

// MARK: - Environment Key for Theme
struct DesignThemeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: DesignTheme = .defaultLight
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var designTheme: DesignTheme {
        get { self[DesignThemeKey.self] }
        set { self[DesignThemeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

// MARK: - View Extension for Easy Theme Access
extension View {
    func withDesignTheme() -> some View {
        self.environment(\.designTheme,
            colorScheme == .dark ? .defaultDark : .defaultLight)
    }
}
```

**Migration Strategy:**
Instead of creating new tokens, we'll:
1. Use existing `DesignTheme.defaultLight` and `DesignTheme.defaultDark`
2. Access colors via `theme.color(.primary)`, `theme.color(.background)`, etc.
3. Access fonts via `theme.font(.body)`, `theme.font(.title1)`, etc.
4. Add spacing/radius extensions for layout consistency
5. Create gradients that reference the existing color tokens

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- âœ… Design system already documented with usage examples
- âœ… Semantic naming already in place (DSColorToken)
- âœ… Dynamic Type support already implemented
- [ ] Spacing and radius extensions added
- [ ] Theme available via Environment
